Bible Verse: Thou shalt not steal.~
Shakespeare Sentence: “Thou shalt not steal”?

Bible Verse: And he wrote a letter after this manner:~
Shakespeare Sentence: Look, here’s a letter from him.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.~
Shakespeare Sentence: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

Bible Verse: I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.~
Shakespeare Sentence: This is a witness that I am thy son.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.~
Shakespeare Sentence: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and let my cry come unto thee.~
Shakespeare Sentence: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Pray hear me.

Bible Verse: Give ear, O LORD, unto my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.~
Shakespeare Sentence: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

Bible Verse: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.~
Shakespeare Sentence: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

Bible Verse: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.~
Shakespeare Sentence: God comfort thee!

Bible Verse: Seek ye the LORD while he may be found, call ye upon him while he is near:~
Shakespeare Sentence: Seek him, bid him come hither.

Bible Verse: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.~
Shakespeare Sentence:
O, I am mock’d,
And thou by some incensed god sent hither
To make the world to laugh at me.

Bible Verse: But if we hope for that we see not, then do we with patience wait for it.~
Shakespeare Sentence: We must be patient.

Bible Verse: Or a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Or a conjurer.

Bible Verse: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I beseech you, follow.

Bible Verse: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.~
Shakespeare Sentence: let us hear him.

Bible Verse: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.~
Shakespeare Sentence: This oath I willingly take and will perform.

Bible Verse: And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these things, that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that thing:~
Shakespeare Sentence: He hath confess’d.

Bible Verse: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Hear me, for I will speak.

Bible Verse: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Fear comes upon me.

Bible Verse: I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I have sworn to do it.

Bible Verse: Hear my prayer, O God; give ear to the words of my mouth.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I pray thee hear me speak.

Bible Verse: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.~
Shakespeare Sentence: let us hear him.

Bible Verse: Then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me, and I will hearken unto you.~
Shakespeare Sentence:
I am bound to call upon you, and I pray you
your name?

Bible Verse: And the LORD said, I have pardoned according to thy word:~
Shakespeare Sentence: I pardon him, as God shall pardon me.

Bible Verse: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I prithee, hear me speak.

Bible Verse: Thou shalt not kill.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Thou shalt not do’t.

Bible Verse: Thou shalt not kill.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Thou shalt not do’t.

Bible Verse: Him therefore I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see how it will go with me.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I will send him hither to you presently.

Bible Verse: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.~
Shakespeare Sentence: These ears of mine, thou know’st, did hear thee.

Bible Verse: That day is a day of wrath, a day of trouble and distress, a day of wasteness and desolation, a day of darkness and gloominess, a day of clouds and thick darkness,~
Shakespeare Sentence: Accurs’d, unhappy, wretched, hateful day.

Bible Verse: He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Lend thine ear.

Bible Verse: Then was the part of the hand sent from him; and this writing was written.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Had he a hand to write this?

Bible Verse: Thou shalt be perfect with the LORD thy God.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Thou art perfect.

Bible Verse: And there appeared an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening him.~
Shakespeare Sentence:
But near him, thy angel
Becomes afeard, as being o’erpowered.

Bible Verse: And when the king entered into the house of the LORD, the guard came and fetched them, and brought them again into the guard chamber.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Enter King and Guard.

Bible Verse: Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I pray you, let-a me speak a word with your ear.

Bible Verse: And the thing pleased the king and all the congregation.~
Shakespeare Sentence: It was the pleasure of my lord the King.

Bible Verse: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Therefore use thy discretion.

Bible Verse: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.~
Shakespeare Sentence:
Ay, now begins a second storm to rise,
For this is he that moves both wind and tide.

Bible Verse: The LORD make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:~
Shakespeare Sentence:
Now,
the Lord bless that sweet face of thine!

Bible Verse: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I pray thee hear me speak.

Bible Verse: Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Lend thine ear.

Bible Verse: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.~
Shakespeare Sentence: How much thou wrong’st me, heaven be my judge.

Bible Verse: For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.~
Shakespeare Sentence: I’ll make thee an example.

Bible Verse: Neither shalt thou steal.~
Shakespeare Sentence: “Thou shalt not steal”?

Bible Verse: Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour: mine adversaries are all before thee.~
Shakespeare Sentence: ’Tis thou, and those, that have dishonoured me.

Bible Verse: I love the LORD, because he hath heard my voice and my supplications.~
Shakespeare Sentence: Ay, I praise God; and I have merited some love at his hands.

Bible Verse: And he wrote a letter after this manner:~
Shakespeare Sentence: Has here writ a letter to you.
